programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Join Gethin Jones, Kym Marsh, Sara Cox, Kimberley Walsh, Sam Quek, Rav Wilding and their family of experts for conversation, advice and great company.

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Working with ethical hackers to intercept cyber-criminals in the act, helping to prevent vulnerable people falling victim.

programme.title: Maximum Security
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood gets hands on with a sledgehammer as he finds out how security products are tested to make sure they keep out thieves and criminals. Sukie Madahar visits a vaults to see how they're using the latest in high tech to protect the treasures in their safe deposit boxes. And home security expert Jenny Donaldson helps out some neighbours who need to protect their properties after a series of thefts in the area.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel is in Merthyr Tydfill to meet a first-time developer looking to move away from her nine-to-five lifestyle by renovating a two-bed end terrace. We return to Lower Gornal in the West Midlands to check on the progress of a mother and daughter who were converting a property into two flats, and Jacqui is in Coventry to see a three-bed end terrace.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents today's show from Shepton Mallet Antiques, Vintage and Collectors Fair. Helped by experts Kate Bliss and Colin Young, the teams scour the stalls for the most profitable items to sell at auction. Charlie heads to Wells Cathedral to marvel at the oldest clock with a dial in the world.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news.

programme.title: BBC London
programme.desc: News, sport and weather from London.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Nina unveils her plan to save the Beechwalk, Al clashes with Kirsty, and Sid meets a taxi driver who is struggling to reconnect with his son.

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: John Craven explores the counties at the very heart of England and celebrates their spring beauty, wildlife and cultural sites including a visit to Shakespeare country, stopping off at the childhood home of Anne Hathaway.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Three generations of one family want to move to the East Midlands, and the task of finding a new home for them all has fallen on mum, grandma, and Ginny Buckley. Away from looking at houses, Ginny meets a volunteer group helping to restore the area's local canals and their footpaths so that wildlife can thrive and the public can enjoy a safer stroll.

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: The public bring in more items for the dealers to bid on. Today, there's two 1930s suitcases, a magic lantern, a condiment holder, a tin plate toy and a fairground car-come table.

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the quiz show where players face a question and pick from a board of six rankable answers. Some answers are good, but only one is unbeatable.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: A twist on the classic quiz show formula, contestants search through the depths of their knowledge in an attempt to score as few points as possible.

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather.

programme.title: BBC London
programme.desc: News, sport and weather from London.

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest
programme.desc: Join Rylan and Liverpool's own Sunetra Sarker as Eurovision week kicks off. There will be highlights from this year's turquoise carpet, with Rylan and Sunetra catching up with this year's 37 Eurovision acts. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together, and Rylan spends time backstage for all the final Eurovision preparations.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The residents of Walford try to pull off the perfect coronation party, Rocky is tempted to meddle in Sonia and Reiss's relationship, and Linda grapples with her decision to deceive Sharon.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: It's the fifth and final week of the heats, and once more the judges have a set of challenges the passionate amateurs must complete in order to progress in the competition. Nine home cooks arrive with both their dreams and ingredients ready for their first test, the Audition Round.

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event, with an audience on a par with the American Superbowl, creating global superstars and leaving an impact on the lives of millions.

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: The latest national and international news.

programme.title: BBC London
programme.desc: News, sport and weather from London.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is guest host, with panellists comedian Maisie Adam and journalist Helen Lewis joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news.

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: It's the MUAs' first assignment and they're heading to a film studio in Greater London, the set of one of Netflix's biggest dramas: `Bridgerton'. In the crowd tent, they meet hair and make-up designer Erika Ökvist, their first tough boss who they need to impress. Working on supporting actors, the MUAs have to deliver flawless, flirtatious, mesmerising looks.

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Working with ethical hackers to intercept cyber-criminals in the act, helping to prevent vulnerable people falling victim.

programme.title: Maximum Security
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood fulfills a childhood dream, riding up front with a train driver as he checks out all the tech keeping the UK's railways safe. He sees how bouncers are trained to keep the peace on a night out. And home security expert Jenny Donaldson has advice on how to deal with distraction burglary when she meets a guy who unwittingly let a thief into his home.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A detached house in Whittlesey in Cambridgeshire, a property in Tunstall in Stoke and a terraced house full of period features in Ipswich in Suffolk are all sold at online auctions. Tommy and Jacqui meet the new owners and learn about their plans to make some money from their investments.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles and the teams are in Dorking in Surrey. Experts Caroline Hawley and Ochuko Ojiri guide the reds and the blues round local antiques shops, as they look for bargains to sell at the auction. Eric also learns how the nation's stained-glass windows are restored and repaired.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news.

programme.title: BBC London
programme.desc: News, sport and weather from London.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob makes a big decision about the future. Nina hopes to pull off her big plan, Tanisha makes a tempting offer, and Bear and Sid try to help a young man who fears his illness has returned.

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: John Craven stops off at Broadway Tower in Worcestershire, which was designed by Capability Brown and has unparalleled views across 16 counties. Meanwhile, Margherita Taylor investigates the issue of litter in the oceans.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson teams up with a calligrapher from East London who wants to write a new chapter in the West Country for her £400k budget. When he's not presenting beautiful property, Jules also gets in tune with the region's nautical traditions and attends a sea shanty festival on the southern coast.

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers welcomes more members of the public hoping to sell items to the dealers. Today, a curious pub game, an unusual statue, an apothecary set, a coffee grinder and a rocking horse.

programme.desc: John visits Broughton Castle in Oxfordshire, once besieged by royalists after the owners raised an army to fight King Charles I. Also, Margherita finds out what can be done about the 300,000 tonnes of clothing that is dumped into landfill each year.

programme.desc: Kathy's Eurovision-themed birthday party is beset by drama, the new co-owner of The Vic makes their presence felt, and Sharon and Linda's friendship lies in tatters.

programme.desc: Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina host the second semi-final, live from Liverpool. Rylan and Scott Mills are on commentary duty and UK viewers have the opportunity to vote for their favourite from 16 acts competing for the remaining places in Saturday's grand final. The UK's entry, Mae Muller, will appear with an exclusive preview of her grand final performance. All this plus two amazing interval acts.

programme.title: Question Time

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Weekly political chat with Laura Kuenssberg, Adam Fleming, Katya Adler and Chris Mason.

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Across the four corners of Britain, on stages and behind closed doors, hundreds of communities, friends, neighbours and colleagues are getting together to experience the power, joy and togetherness singing in a choir brings. As the nation prepares for the coronation of King Charles III, a very special choir is given the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing their hearts out for the King and Queen Consort and the millions watching around the world at the Coronation Concert in Windsor Castle.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents an hour of topical debate from Telford in Shropshire. On the panel, Mark Harper MP, Transport Secretary, from Labour, the shadow foreign secretary David Lammy MP, Minette Batters, who is President of the National Farmers Union, the journalist and author Peter Hitchens and the musician Billy Bragg.

programme.title: Last Woman on Earth with Sara Pascoe
programme.desc: Writer and comedian Sara Pascoe returns with her unique travelogue learning how to do the world's endangered jobs. In Denmark, she learns how to build from a Lego master and make a roof out of seaweed with a group of thatchers.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents a right royal showdown to celebrate the coronation of King Charles III. Experts Raj Bisram and Roo Irvine are on hand to help two teams of royal enthusiasts as they race to be crowned winners. Christina also visits a pottery for an exclusive look at some new commemorative ware, and she makes her own royal plate fit for a king.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
programme.desc: Starting at his favourite holiday spot on the Amalfi coast, Clive goes inland to a mozzarella factory, where he discovers how to make everyone's favourite stringy cheese. Next, he heads to Capri, where he makes his wife Catherine a pair of the Capri sandals made famous by Jackie Kennedy and spends the evening singing Italian folk songs on stage at a club favoured by A-listers like Beyonce and Jay Z.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick delves into the stories of those who worked in Cornwall's mines, from the men who laboured in extreme heat a full hour's journey beneath the earth's surface to the young women known as `bal maidens'.

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Banjo has been commissioned by fish shop manager and friend Sally, who wants to modernise her family's traditional business in Tobermory. Banjo has bold plans to utterly transform both the inside and outside of the shop, but Sally is worried that her family will disapprove of the radical makeover. With his band of trusty locals, including Eoghann the carpenter and handyman Tom, Banjo takes huge risks in realising his design ambitions.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Contestants compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: The Eggheads team are made up of some of Britain's top quizzers. They face a team of challengers trying to beat the incumbents in order to win a cash prize. If the Eggheads beat the challengers, the cash prize is rolled over to subsequent episodes.

programme.title: Live: Badminton Horse Trials
programme.desc: Coverage of the final day at the Badminton Horse Trials, one of the highlights on the equestrian calendar. With the dressage and cross-country done and dusted, it's time for the show jumping segment, which decides the final placings. In 2022, Olympic gold medallist Laura Collett set the lowest score in the 73-year history of the trials as she won the event for the first time on her horse London 52.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Music Week brings three different musical and sartorial genres to the Sewing Bee. Sara Pascoe kicks off the week with a pattern for the parka coat that was adopted by Mod culture in the 1960s. With its classic fishtail vent and complex zip opening and hood, this is a feat of engineering. Country music is the inspiration for the Transformation Challenge, as the sewers take old denim and turn it into stage gear worthy of Dolly Parton.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team are in Scotland today at Culzean Castle in Ayrshire. Hundreds of local people arrive with their family heirlooms for valuations and the experts choose a selection of antiques to go off to auction.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Sean Fletcher, Louise Minchin, Chris Washington and Kimberly Wyatt take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
programme.desc: Staying in what was one of Naples' poorest neighbourhoods, in a hotel that's also an art gallery, Clive discovers how this always-colourful city is changing for the better. As a big fan of opera, Clive is also excited to join the cast of the Teatro San Carlo opera house in the run up to their opening night, and while in the costume department, he just can't resist trying a few things on.

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Celebrating the highlights from the series, from the intense heat of the tropics to the planet's frozen poles, through to its unexplored depths. New worlds and extraordinary never-before-seen animal behaviours are revealed.

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: It's the last of the quarter-final matches. Two teams return having won one quarter-final and lost another. Whoever wins will take the last place in the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.

Two British soldiers receive seemingly impossible orders during World War I. In a race against time, they must cross into enemy territory to deliver a message that could potentially save 1,600 of their fellow comrades -- including one's own brother.

programme.title: A Life in Ten Pictures
programme.desc: John Lennon's image is known around the world, he is one of the most famous people on the planet. Photos reveal Lennon's lifelong search to find his place in the world.

programme.title: Sounds of Liverpool at the BBC
programme.desc: It's the city that gave birth to the Beatles, inspired Gerry to ride that ferry, and spawned Bunnymen and Atomic Kittens. Forget house music, this is scouse music, rich and varied, with some songs that conquered charts across the world and others that struck a special chord here, from `The Story of the Blues' to `You'll Never Walk Alone', and inevitably, in a city with two massive football teams, Frankie Goes to Hollywood's `Two Tribes'.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: There is no surer sign that spring is here than millions of lambs being born across the UK. Charlotte Smith visits the Outer Hebrides to meet teenage farmer Archie, who despite only being 17, already runs a 600-acre farm on the island of North Uist. Paralympian Sammi Kinghorn is back home lambing on her family farm in the Scottish Borders.

programme.title: Coronation Tailors: Fit for a King
programme.desc: Patrick Grant goes behind the scenes at the family firm making ceremonial uniforms for King Charles's coronation. Tasked with creating thousands of bespoke uniforms for the big day, the Kashket family have been making spectacular ceremonial wear for four generations. As well as discovering the skill and craftmanship required to create these unique garments, Patrick also meets some of the men and women of the armed forces who will wear them.

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne. During that period, every step of Charles' life was captured on camera and his words recorded: from newsreel to home movies from interviews to documentaries.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Today's property development projects run from seven weeks to several years. Martin and Dion track progress on renovations in Bristol and Blackley and a building project on land in Stoke.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
programme.desc: Staying in what was one of Naples' poorest neighbourhoods, in a hotel that's also an art gallery, Clive discovers how this always-colourful city is changing for the better. programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman are on a journey of international food discovery as they take in Belfast's Mela festival, discovering how to make cheap and easy kimchi and authentic Jamaican patties.

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The Coastal Defenders team face one of their smallest but fiercest challenges: mussels. These small but deadly shellfish have blocked the pipes of a huge vessel, stalling it in dock.

programme.desc: Highlights from the latest round of matches in Super League. Current competition leaders Wigan are looking to cement their position at the top of the table when they travel to Hull FC, whilst second-placed Warrington have a home game against the bottom club Wakefield. Hull KR start the round in third place, and go in search of a sixth consecutive victory when they face Huddersfield, whilst the champions St Helens are in the south of France to take on Catalans Dragons.

programme.title: Wonders of the Universe
programme.desc: Having explored the wonders of the solar system, Professor Brian Cox steps boldly on to a bigger stage - the universe. In this episode, Brian seeks to understand the nature of time and its role in creating both the universe and ourselves. From an extraordinary calendar built into the landscape of Peru to the beaches of Costa Rica, Brian explores the cycles of time which define our experience of life on Earth.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: A place in the quarter-final is at stake this week, and the challenges are all about lingerie. Host Sara Pascoe starts the sewers off with a fiddly pattern for a lace underwired bra and matching knicker set. With such small pattern pieces, there is no margin for error, and Patrick and Esme's eagle eyes will spot every mistake. The Transformation Challenge requires the sewers to take thermal underwear and turn it into daywear.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul and the team are in the heart of Birmingham and its historic museum and art gallery. Antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant are searching the queue for the best antiques and collectibles to take to auction.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Sean Fletcher, Louise Minchin, Chris Washington and Kimberly Wyatt take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
programme.desc: Clive heads north from Lazio's capital, Rome, to the dramatic valleys of Italy's badlands, out of which rise the fairy-tale citadel of Civita di Bagnoregio - Lazio's ghost town. Meeting one of the 20 remaining residents, Clive finds out what it's like to be outnumbered by a million annual visitors, and he explores the ancient tunnels beneath the town to discover why it's slowly crumbling to dust.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure
programme.desc: The Hairy Bikers are in Provence. They begin their journey in Marseille, one of the largest ports in the Mediterranean, where the population is as diverse as the Mediterranean itself. The bikers taste bourride, a delicious fish stew.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a factory with a menthol scent - the Polos factory in York, which produces 32 million mints every day and contributes to the 19,000 tonnes of mints per year that the UK consumes. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey visits the largest sugar beet factory in Europe and helps to bring in the harvest on one of the last surviving peppermint farms in the UK. And Ruth Goodman explores the clever marketing that persuaded many people to purchase minty mouthwash.

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: Born at a time when Turkey is ruled by the secular elite, Recep Tayyip Erdogan joins an Islamist party and becomes hugely popular as mayor of Istanbul. But Turkey's constitution forbids the mixing of religion and politics, so when the party Erdogan belongs to is shut down, Erdogan is sent to jail and banned from being an MP for life.

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: The Echo Park gang are impressed when they get to witness Ashley taking charge during a power outage.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Comprehensive coverage of important national and international news stories. It explains the day's developments and what is behind them.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Moonstruck
programme.desc: Superstitious Italian-American widow Loretta is fairly happy to be engaged again, but it's her fiancé's hot-tempered younger brother Ronny who relights her fire. This snappy love story won Oscars for the two leading ladies.

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: In the medieval city of Coimbra, the group split up. Millie, Su, Vickie, Shane and Bobby visit the St Theresa convent and meet a Carmelite nun who served one of the three shepherd children. Nabil finds a mosque for Friday prayers and invites Rita to join him. Keen to connect with her own Jewish culture, Rita seeks out an old synagogue in Tamar and asks Millie to join her.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Nine home cooks aim to progress to the next round of the competition, but they must recreate their Family Favourite dish and face the invention test. For two, their MasterChef dream will be over.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The seven remaining cooks face a challenge set by food critic Leyla Kazim, in which they must create a dish that showcases sourness or bitterness.

Charlie heads to Wells Cathedral to marvel at the oldest clock with a dial in the world.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
programme.desc: Clive heads north from Lazio's capital, Rome, to the dramatic valleys of Italy's badlands, out of which rise the fairy-tale citadel of Civita di Bagnoregio - Lazio's ghost town. Meeting one of the 20 remaining residents, Clive finds out what it's like to be outnumbered by a million annual visitors, and he explores the ancient tunnels beneath the town to discover why it's slowly crumbling to dust.

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Puppy Coal from the Dogs Trust is being treated for aspiration pneumonia, caused by food going into his lungs. He was born at the hospital on Boxing Day by caesarean section, so the team have developed a close bond with him.

programme.title: Take a Hike
programme.desc: Fitness and body coach Zara takes the group on a hike across Llandudno's Great Orme. They climb the hillside to reach the summit, past the historic Great Orme tramway. From there, it's a quick descent down to the west shore.

programme.title: My Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Trap Kitchen, a soul-food inspired takeaway, and Greedy Khao, a vegan Thai grab-and-go idea, are seeking investment from some of the UK's most successful high-street investors.

programme.title: Wonders of the Universe
programme.desc: Hindu philosophy is based on an eternal cycle of creation and destruction, where the physical elements of the body are recycled on to the next stage. Brian draws a parallel with the life cycle of the stars that led to the creation of humanity.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The quarter-final takes the sewers back to the golden era of the 1930s. Esme and Patrick set them a Pattern Challenge for a pair of women's sailor-inspired trousers with a complex bib-front button opening and equally tricky pockets. Then the sewers show off their ability to think on their feet when they are given men's shirts to turn into 1930s women's blouses.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team visit the magnificent Stockport Town Hall in Greater Manchester. Paul Martin is joined by experts Mark Stacey and Philip Serrell in picking out a selection of their favourite antiques to be filmed at auction. Philip spies a collection of evocative war diaries, while Mark falls for a mosaic necklace and earring set that surprises everyone at auction.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Sean Fletcher, Louise Minchin, Chris Washington and Kimberly Wyatt take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
programme.desc: Clive has visited Rome with his wife Catherine and his mates, as well as for the BBC - this time, he heads out of the centre and up one of the city's seven hills to the rarely visited neighbourhood of Monteverde, where he talks football with a butcher and puts his Caribbean cooking knowledge to good use. He also comes to the surprising realisation that if he ever moves to Rome, he'll likely take up cricket.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure
programme.desc: The bikers visit Minorca and Majorca to discover evidence of British influence, fresh fish and local produce. Featured dishes are cuttlefish stew and marinated cuttlefish with mayonnaise, ensaimadas with almond filling and roasted pork with tumbet.

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: With Banjo's design reputation growing, the Isle of Mull Rugby Club hire him to redesign their bar to reflect the club's rich history. But with a large space to fill, and little knowledge of sport, Banjo is out of his creative comfort zone. With only a few days to complete the makeover, Banjo must face up to his past to find a way to complete this tricky brief.

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year
programme.desc: The judges are in the south west where they must choose between an Edwardian townhouse on the Mumbles, a converted watermill near Ammanford and a reimagined cottage in Kidwelly. Scoring them on architectural merit, distinctive design and original style, which home will Owain, Mandy and Glen choose to go forward to the grand final?

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: A few months after his brutal crackdown on protestors in Istanbul's Gezi Park, Erdogan faces another challenge to his rule, a corruption scandal. Blaming it on his one-time ally, the cleric Fethullah Gulen, Erdogan continues to consolidate power, becoming president and transforming the office from a largely ceremonial role to a powerful executive position.

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Lance is obsessed with finding the thief that stole his gold, which means he can ignore the melodrama going on at home. Andy's lies are catching up with him too. They decide that camping out is the safest option.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Comprehensive coverage of important national and international news stories. It explains the day's developments and what is behind them.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Red Joan
programme.desc: A retired widow living in the suburbs is arrested by the British Secret Service for providing classified scientific information, and during interrogation, relives the dramatic events that shaped her life.

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Surgeon Kostas Papagiannopoulos must investigate a suspicious growth on a patient's lung, and cardiologist Andrew Hogarth treats a patient with a life-threatening infection.

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores the Welsh Marches, the borderlands with England, discovering amazing wildlife in this surprisingly diverse area. In the Gwent Levels, he is treated to a chorus of birdsong and hunts for one of the rarest bees in Britain - the shrill carder bee. In the Wye Valley, he sets trail cameras to capture shots of elusive wild boar and searches for the rare hawfinch and camouflaged nightjar. Iolo ends this portion of his journey at Llanthony Priory.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon tests how well his contenders can turn humble ingredients into a profit. In the Lake District, he tasks them with collecting pine needles and cones from 40-foot tall trees to infuse into Michelin-starred millefeuille.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A detached house in Whittlesey in Cambridgeshire, a property in Tunstall in Stoke and a terraced house full of period features in Ipswich in Suffolk are all sold at online auctions. Tommy and Jacqui meet the new owners and learn about their plans to make some money from their investments.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
programme.desc: Clive has visited Rome with his wife Catherine and his mates, as well as for the BBC - this time, he heads out of the centre and up one of the city's seven hills to the rarely visited neighbourhood of Monteverde, where he talks football with a butcher and puts his Caribbean cooking knowledge to good use. He also comes to the surprising realisation that if he ever moves to Rome, he'll likely take up cricket.

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara is joined by presenter Nick Knowles, comedian Sara Barron, presenter and actor Ore Oduba, and Saturday Kitchen wine expert and author Helen McGinn. They share their favourite books and review the two book club choices: the new book pick, `Hungry Ghosts' by Kevin Jared Hosein, and the fifth of a selection of books set in Europe to celebrate Eurovision, `I'm Not Scared' by Niccolò Ammaniti, which is set in Italy.

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Undercover cops pick up an international gang of pickpockets. A couple are stunned to find a stranger in their hallway, and a reckless lorry driver reverses on a motorway into oncoming traffic.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The big political issues of the day.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Contestants compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: The Eggheads team are made up of some of Britain's top quizzers. They face a team of challengers trying to beat the incumbents in order to win a cash prize. If the Eggheads beat the challengers, the cash prize is rolled over to subsequent episodes.

programme.title: My Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Bubble&, a bubble and squeak idea created by a husband and wife team, and Dynasty, a high-end, vegan-friendly Korean idea, are seeking investment from some of the UK's most successful high-street investors.

programme.title: Wonders of the Universe
programme.desc: Gravity seems so familiar, and yet it is one of the strangest and most surprising forces in the universe. Starting with a zero-gravity flight, Brian experiences the feeling of total weightlessness, and considers how much of an effect gravity has had on the world.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe welcomes the four semi-finalists into the Sewing Room to celebrate the influences of Japanese design and sewing. For the Pattern Challenge, Esme has collaborated with a Japanese designer to come up with a kimono-inspired dress that proves to be a brain-teaser. This is for a place in the final, after all.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team revisit some of the locations from the series, including Greenwich Royal Naval College, Althorp House and Herstmonceux Castle, with brand new valuations. Paul Martin is in Devon discovering how one man's lace business transformed a town.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Sean Fletcher, Louise Minchin, Chris Washington and Kimberly Wyatt take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
programme.desc: As long as the water's warm, Clive loves to swim, so he's enthusiastic about taking a dip in the vast volcanic spring of Saturnia and discovering why Italians believe in the healing power of thermal water. Travelling on through Maremma - a big stretch of country running between Tuscany and Lazio - Clive stays in a treehouse at a lavender farm and learns how to extract oil from the plants.

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: In a revealing interview about Piers Morgan's rollercoaster career and personal life, Amol Rajan explores everything from hacking allegations to the divisive media figure's belief in God. From sackings to superstardom, from being punched by Jeremy Clarkson to his role in the culture wars, Morgan reveals the emotional and physical scars he has picked up over the decades.

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Paul explores the Argyll coast, travelling from the sacred sands of Kilmory Bay on Loch Sween. On Lilly Loch in Knapdale forest he gets a glimpse of beavers, before joining a group of steam enthusiasts restoring an old puffer on the Crinan Canal.

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Richard is on a life-long mission to discover the identity of his father, Janet wants to know if she has a secret sister, and Glen hopes his DNA can finally reveal his ancestry.

programme.title: Guilt
programme.desc: Max, Jake and their new gang hide from Maggie in Edinburgh and discover her link to Sir Jim Sturrock. Maggie exerts pressure on Teddy, while Aliza risks the bank sale.

programme.title: Inside No. 9
programme.desc: You get to meet all sorts when you go online dating, as Vicky's about to find out. Will she finally meet her perfect match? Or will she be talking to the Lonely Hearts Killer?

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Comprehensive coverage of important national and international news stories. It explains the day's developments and what is behind them.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: Born at a time when Turkey is ruled by the secular elite, Recep Tayyip Erdogan joins an Islamist party and becomes hugely popular as mayor of Istanbul. But Turkey's constitution forbids the mixing of religion and politics, so when the party Erdogan belongs to is shut down, Erdogan is sent to jail and banned from being an MP for life.

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: A few months after his brutal crackdown on protestors in Istanbul's Gezi Park, Erdogan faces another challenge to his rule, a corruption scandal. Blaming it on his one-time ally, the cleric Fethullah Gulen, Erdogan continues to consolidate power, becoming president and transforming the office from a largely ceremonial role to a powerful executive position.

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: St. Hugh of Lincoln Primary School is in Manchester, many of their pupils have specific needs and would benefit from a space of their own. But the school has no extra space! Ginger, meanwhile, gets a nice letter from her Aunt Agatha who is planning a trip to the UK.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Mr Tumble helps Grandad Tumble water his vegetables - and lots of splashing fun is had! Meanwhile, Justin and his friends have fun gardening and making a scarecrow.

programme.title: My Petsaurus
programme.desc: Fluffy's toilet training doesn't quite go as well as Megan had hoped.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: It is sleepybyes time, so the Teletubbies say goodnight to the Tiddytubbies. But Po isn't tired and goes for a special ride on her scooter.

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome babies Noah, Baani, Millana, Amber, Amelia, Jace, Hunter and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Inside everyone's bags are cups which are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding baby appropriate cups inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby!

programme.title: What's in Your Bag?
programme.desc: Dr Milad the dentist explains how his dental mirror helps him to check that teeth are strong and healthy.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits

programme.title: Vegesaurs

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Nurse Bingo gives Dad an x-ray which reveals he has a cat in his tummy and Dr Bluey has to operate immediately.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: It's Woodworking Day, and Love Monster has a very special project planned. He uses his tools to craft a toy aero plane from a wooden log.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: It's Fluffytown Swap Day, and Love Monster is in his attic looking for things that he doesn't need so he can swap them with people who do need them.

programme.title: School of Roars
programme.desc: Mr Bogglelots, the optician, visits the school to give the little monsters a very special eye test. Wufflebump gets the test wrong on purpose just to get a pair of googly glasses, but soon realises that wearing the wrong glasses isn't good for your eyes.

programme.title: My Petsaurus
programme.desc: Chloe finds out two pet dinos are more exhausting than one, when Topsy and Tippy both want to play.

programme.title: Olga da Polga
programme.desc: Olga makes a friend, Venables the toad. But when Karen reveals her family are planning toad-in-the hole for tea, Olga mounts a rescue mission to hide Venables and keep him safe!

programme.title: Get Well Soon
programme.desc: Dr Ranj isn't surprised that Riz feels so tired because he doesn't sleep for long and doesn't eat very healthy food. Plus, Nurse Morag and the Healthy Helpers put together a balanced diet jigsaw.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Holly comes from the English city, Liverpool. She will be making two tasty recipes. The first is a local Merseyside stew called scouse, made with chopped and cooked carrots, potatoes and onions with gravy, and her special ingredient: celery.

programme.title: Maddie's Do You Know?
programme.desc: Maddie explains how the sun doesn't move when we go from day to night, but how it's the earth turning on its axis that makes the sun appear in the morning and go away again at night. She uses a special time-lapse camera at sunset to show the earth turning away from the sun when it is `going down' at night time. Next, Maddie heads to a solar panel farm.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: It's Bring-a-Toy-to-School Day, so Evie takes the trolley she's just been given for her fifth birthday. Waffle hides in it and ends up in Evie's class, where he must keep very still so he isn't seen.

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Mo encourages Tee to have a `Tee Can Do It' day where he tries to do everything without help from her. She soon realises that Tee doing everything himself gives her lots more work.

programme.title: Pablo
programme.desc: Pablo wants to play with Lorna and her friend, but it's making Noa feel wobbly and that makes the Art World wobbly too. Can they all find a way to play without joining in?

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say `milk' and they go on a whirlwind word adventure. There's white milk, pink milk, baby milk and banana milk. The journey is repeated with some special surprises along the way and everyone has a boogie when Dee's friend finally succeeds in saying today's word.

programme.title: Numberblocks

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: When Alphablock I starts making up new laws, AU are soon on the run, with AW in hot pursuit.

programme.title: Dog Loves Books

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: As Roly makes his usual noise in the Clubhouse, Duggee and the Squirrels reminisce about how completely different Roly was when he first arrived. Hiding behind his dad, Roly wasn't loud at all but impossibly quiet. As Duggee shows Roly around the Clubhouse, he squeals, hides and hangs off his dad, and just seems altogether too shy to fit in. Duggee has a great idea to introduce Roly to Norrie, thinking a friend will help him to settle in.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: After Love Monster volunteers Monster Teddy to pose for everyone's paintings, he realises he misses him when they are apart. Things get even worse when Bad Idea Puppy moves Monster Teddy further away to stop him getting splashed with paint.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Red and Yellow sort different coloured objects onboard the Sorting Express. Learn to spot the difference between colours and shades with the Colourblocks.

programme.desc: Chilli decides to become a superhero called Super Chilli. His superhero skills are put to the test when Evil Pea covers Supertato in sticky honey, but Chilli's heat saves the day.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Glitch gets into a mountain of trouble as the Go Jetters attempt to climb the Matterhorn.

programme.desc: Motorbike rider Grace shows off three amazing machines that run on rails. Grace helps drive a tram that can go up a very big hill, shows off a monorail and is a co-driver in a high-speed train.

programme.desc: Cook and Line take Captain Captain's order to polish the Scarlet Squid to extremes. Maddie, Conor, Rhea and Jun play Shivering Timbers and Coconutty Raft before taking on the Shipwreck Rummage to try and win back Gem's jewels.

programme.title: Hey Duggee

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: When the auditions for Mr Jeremy Fisher's annual recital attract the attention of Mr Tod, it's up to Peter to save the day with some musical mischief of his own.

programme.title: Andy's Dinosaur Adventures
programme.desc: Andy travels back in time 152 million years, to the time of Diplodocus, a massive 25 metre long plant-eating dinosaur. His mission, to find a dung beetle.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: When Kwazii discovers a blue whale with an injured tail, the Octonauts attempt to use a giant net and Octofloats to keep it from sinking. Meanwhile, Peso and Tweak collaborate on a special brace for its tail, and Kwazii, Dashi and Shellington try to find it enough food. But when the supporting net breaks, the Octonauts have to launch an emergency free-fall rescue!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo pretend that they are living on a desert island in the back garden and they discover Dad washed up on the beach. Dad needs to embrace his inner kid if he wants to make Bingo and Bluey's Rug Island his home, too.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Dad shows the kids how to use their old baby-harness, a new game is born: Dad Baby. However, dad is unprepared for the harsh realities of giving birth to a baby Bingo.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea takes all the books from the supermarket. Supertato, Chilli and Carrot try to rescue them by using acrobatic skills that they learnt from their favourite circus book.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Grandmaster Glitch demands the Grimbots find somewhere with no cars so he can practise riding his bike without stabilisers. He arrives in Venice and is delighted to find the `streets' are empty.

programme.title: Dipdap
programme.desc: The Line draws a cute thing. Dipdap tries to protect it from heavy objects drawn by the line.

programme.title: Sarah & Duck

programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo spend the day at Nana's and want everyone to play charades, but their cousins Muffin and Socks are too young to understand the rules. Nana must quickly think of how to keep the game on track.

programme.desc: Bluey, Bingo and Mum play Keepy-Uppy around the house with their last balloon, but it becomes competitive when Dad joins in.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Bad Idea Puppy listens in on a Council of Cuteness meeting and mishears that Take My Time Tortoise is moving. The false news spreads as he and Love Monster plan a leaving party.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Love Monster is ready to party on Party All Day Day. Elder Chick is the MC for the day and says that she is loving Love Monster's party spirit, but she warns him to make sure he saves some energy for the grand finale conga at the end of the day.

programme.title: School of Roars
programme.desc: When Wingston becomes too whizzy in class, Miss Grizzlesniff decides he should learn about "sportsmonstership" by having a race with his friends. Wingston soon discovers that being a good sportsmonster is not just about winning.

programme.title: My Petsaurus
programme.desc: A game of snakes and ladders is anything but simple for Chloe and Megan when Fluffy is on the prowl.

programme.desc: The Sawdusts prepare for the big family fun run. Olga gets preparations underway with the help of Graham and Fangio, but when the family unexpectedly disappears, she's worried she's missed out. A tired Sawdust family return and put Olga out for her run. She shocks everyone with a speedy lap of the enclosure to show off her racing skills. Karen decides Olga deserves a medal for having fun in her run.

programme.desc: Dr Ranj cheers up Kiwa when he says the itchy spots she has won't stop her from going camping, while Nurse Morag and the Healthy Helpers play a game of chase to show why the spots are so itchy.

programme.desc: Leo's family is from Russia, and they have shown him how to make a special sharlotka, a simple Russian apple cake. Leo starts by separating the eggs. He then adds sugar and flour to the yolks and mixes them together until the mixture is smooth.

programme.title: Maddie's Do You Know?
programme.desc: Maddie visits a singing group and the children help us find out how we use our mouths, vocal chords and lungs to make different sounds when we sing and speak. Maddie uses a special machine to measure the different high and low sounds that we make. Next, she visits a trombone factory to see how copper and zinc metals are made into brass trombones.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle and Doug give Evie a birthday gift, and the Brooklyn-Bells discover Mrs Hobbs' new rollerskating hobby. Evie makes a wish at her party to receive a card from her birth dad.

programme.desc: When an alien ship crashes in Numberland, the Numberblocks decide to help the alien get back home. The alien can create lots of blocks like the Numberblocks, so they build a tower into the sky.

programme.desc: Alphablocks IR meet the birthday girl, throw a party for her and make her special wish come true.

The Squirrels go outside the Clubhouse with Duggee and watch all the animals take formation. We see a complete match on the right and left sides.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Rain is forecast in Fluffytown, but Love Monster is excited because his friends are coming round for an indoor activity day. They're going to knit onesies, drink hot chocolate and build a pillow fort!
